title: Welcome to CY105

About Me

BS Computer Science, San Jose State Univ

Commissioned as Cyber Officer
OCO, Tactical, DCO, Company Cdr

Love to travel and hike
Enjoy new (vegetarian) foods!

title: Welcome to CY105
text:
CY105 Course Objectives

Examine legal, ethical, professional, and security issues associated with the cyber domain.
Function as an ethical, secure, and competent user in West Point’s immersive technology and cyber environment.
Apply sequential logic, control flow statements, and code libraries using a modern programming language, algorithmic thinking, and a problem-solving process.
Describe how data flows from data sources across air, land, sea, and cyberspace to form a network of information that is constantly being tracked and exploited by allies, adversaries, and third parties.
Describe and explore the opportunities and challenges presented by artificial intelligence in the modern world.

title: Welcome to CY105
text:
What’s in it for you?





“Information superiority is the operational advantage derived from the ability to collect, process, and disseminate an uninterrupted flow of information while exploiting or denying an adversary’s ability to do the same…”
FM 3-0, Operations, February 2008​



Understanding the foundations of IT will: - enhance your effectiveness and efficiency in ANY discipline​ - increase your confidence with West Point IT systems critical to success at the academy​ - help you learn how to learn new IT concepts and systems​ - allow you to proactively employ IT to solve problems to protect yourself and your organization

title: Welcome to CY105
text:
Section Marcher Duties



Exhibit peer leadership
Volunteer section marcher for first 4 lessons
Plus Assistant Section Marcher
Remaining section marchers will be assigned based on PDR assignments
Duties

Inspection at beginning of class
Attendance
Briefly inspect uniforms, general appearance
No food, gum or backpacks

If Dean or Supt visit, call class to attention

Click “Please complete this module”
Click “Load Cengage Unlimited Multi-term 24 months Instant Access to a new window”
Register for an account using westpoint.edu email address
Open the Microsoft 365 lesson module and click the “Cengage: Microsoft 365 Pre-Class Exercise (ungraded)” link
Log in
Enroll in the course

title: Welcome to CY105
text: Next Class

title: Computing Fundamentals
text: This course introduces the fundamentals of computing and cyberspace and blends theoretical knowledge with the practical application of computer hardware, software (programming), and cyberspace. Emphasis is placed on developing critical thinking skills and understanding the legal, ethical, and professional considerations as well as the challenges, opportunities, and attributes of the cyber domain.

title: Computing Fundamentals
text:
Course Objectives

Examine legal, ethical, professional, and security issues associated with the cyber domain.
Function as an ethical, secure, and competent user in West Point’s immersive technology and cyber environment.
Apply sequential logic, control flow statements, and code libraries using a modern programming language, algorithmic thinking, and a problem-solving process.
Describe how data flows from data sources across air, land, sea, and cyberspace to form a network of information that is constantly being tracked and exploited by allies, adversaries, and third parties.
Describe and explore the opportunities and challenges presented by artificial intelligence in the modern world.
